ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:0.5_0: 41. The training rule on without bringing
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six opened their mouths without bringing a mouthful to it. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not open my mouth without bringing a mouthful to it,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.4_0: he should not open his mouth when a mouthful hasn’t been brought to it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, opens his mouth without bringing a mouthful to it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.9_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
